newsitem.title: USA: Computer Sciences wins Navy contract.
newsitem.headline: Computer Sciences wins Navy contract.

text.p: Computer Sciences Corp said Tuesday the Navy's Naval Command, Control and Ocean Surveillance Center had selected it to provide engineering and technical support services under a blanket purchase agreement through March 1999.
The pact provides CSC with an option to extend the contract through to March 2002.
CSC will provide engineering and technical services as ordered in support of the center's efforts to provide technology systems, integrated information and telecommunication support.
CSC said a blanket purchase agreements allows federal buyers to fill recurring needs while taking advantage of quantity discounts.
CSC provides professional services including management consulting, business process reengineering, information systems consulting and outsourcing.
